EdgeCaseNotes: Must exist in CAD for valid merge; orphaned RMS records indicate data sync issues

PrecedenceRules: Only fill if CAD.FullAddress2 is NULL or invalid
EdgeCaseNotes: Apply only when CAD address is blank or fails validation; preserve CAD address if valid

PrecedenceRules: Use IncidentType1 first if CAD.Incident is NULL
EdgeCaseNotes: First priority in incident backfill hierarchy; map via CallType_Categories.csv if needed

PrecedenceRules: Use IncidentType2 if CAD.Incident and IncidentType1 are NULL
EdgeCaseNotes: Second priority; only applies when IncidentType1 unavailable

PrecedenceRules: Use IncidentType3 if CAD.Incident and IncidentType1/2 are NULL
EdgeCaseNotes: Third priority; last fallback for incident classification

PrecedenceRules: Append RMS.Narrative to CAD.CADNotes with delimiter
EdgeCaseNotes: Separate with ' | RMS: ' delimiter; preserve both narratives
Large discrepancy may indicate data entry error or delayed arrest
Parse rank/badge/name; RMS may have more complete officer names

ValidationRule: Both systems use similar but not identical disposition codes

PrecedenceRules: Fill CAD.Latitude if NULL and RMS.Latitude exists
EdgeCaseNotes: RMS geocoding may be more accurate for certain locations

PrecedenceRules: Fill CAD.Longitude if NULL and RMS.Longitude exists
EdgeCaseNotes: Validate coordinate pairs are in Hackensack bounds

PrecedenceRules: Cross-validate with CAD victim age if present
EdgeCaseNotes: Flag if ages differ by more than 1 year (data entry error indicator)

PrecedenceRules: Fill CAD.UCRCode from RMS if NULL
EdgeCaseNotes: RMS UCR coding may be more accurate due to report review process
